label: ash
definition: An environmental material that is the non-aqueous, non-gaseous residues that remain after something is burned.

label: coal
definition: A combustible black or brownish-black sedimentary rock usually occurring in rock strata in layers or veins called coal beds or coal seams.

label: ore
definition: a type of rock that contains sufficient minerals with important elements including metals that can be economically extracted from the rock.

label: coal dust
definition: Dust which is derived from coal.

label: mineral dust
definition: Dust which is derived from mineral material.

label: fibrous dust
definition: Dust which is composed of fibrous material.

label: metallic dust
definition: Dust which is composed primarily of some metallic material.

label: clay dust
definition: Dust which is derived from clay material.

label: grain dust
definition: Dust that comes from grain and all the other substances associated with its cultivation & harvesting.

label: fume
definition: A gas, smoke, or vapor that smells strongly or is dangerous to inhale.

label: vanadium fume
definition: Respirable vapor of vanadium.

label: natural wax
definition: A wax that is naturally synthesized by a plant or animal.

label: paraffin wax
definition: A white or colourless soft solid derivable from petroleum, coal or oil shale, that consists of a mixture of hydrocarbon molecules containing between twenty and forty carbon atoms.

label: oil shale
definition: An organic-rich fine-grained sedimentary rock containing kerogen from which liquid hydrocarbons called shale oil can be produced.

label: paint
definition: Any liquid, liquefiable, or mastic composition that, after application to a substrate in a thin layer, converts to a solid film. It is most commonly used to protect, color, or provide texture to objects.

label: lead paint
definition: Paint that contains lead.

label: wood ash
definition: the residue powder that is derived from the combustion of wood.

label: coal ash
definition: Ash that is produced from the burning of coal.

label: fly ash
definition: A very fine, powdery material composed mostly of silica made from the burning of finely ground coal in a boiler.

label: bottom ash
definition: a coarse, angular ash particle that is too large to be carried up into the smoke stacks so it forms in the bottom of the coal furnace.

label: boiler slag
definition: molten bottom ash from slag tap and cyclone type furnaces that turns into pellets that have a smooth glassy appearance after it is cooled with water.

label: flue gas desulfurization material
definition: a material leftover from the process of reducing sulfur dioxide emissions from a coal-fired boiler that can be a wet sludge consisting of calcium sulfite or calcium sulfate or a dry powered material that is a mixture of sulfites and sulfates.

label: fluid environmental material
definition: A liquid or a gas.

label: neve
definition: Partially compacted granular snow, which has undergone several cycles of melting and refreezing while being compacted, usually found on the atmosphere-exposed surface of a glacier.

label: firn
definition: Granular snow which contains a proportion of fused granules formed through melting and re-thawing while being compacted by the weight of overlying material and which contains interconnected gaseous pores.

label: glacial ice
definition: Any water ice that is part of a glacier.

label: erosionally enriched glacial ice
definition: Glacial ice which contains material liberated during a glacial erosion process.

label: blue ice
definition: Water ice containing little to no air bubbles resulting in a reduction of internal light scattering and, given sufficient volume, a blue appearance.

label: soot
definition: Particulate matter primarily composed of carbon particles formed through the incomplete combustion of hydrocarbons.

label: erosionally enriched ice
definition: Water ice which contains material liberated during an erosion process.

label: powdery snow
definition: Uncompacted snow containing trapped atmospheric gases.

label: marine sediment
definition: Sediment which has been transported through the marine water column, settling on the seafloor.

label: shallow marine sediment
definition: Marine sediment soured from either terrestrial systems, marine organisms, seawater and or cosmogeneous sources, which is transported through the marine water column, and accumulates within shallow regions of the oceanic basin close to continents, such as the continental shelf, or continental slope.

label: cryoconite deposit
definition: Particulate matter which is composed primarily of dust, rock, and soot, as well as the microbial communities associated with these materials, deposited on an ice mass by an aeolian process.

label: frazil ice
definition: New ice which is composed frazil which has congealed into a thin sheet.

label: new ice
definition: Water ice which is formed from freezing water and is suspended in a water body.

label: ice floe
definition: A cohesive and contiguous sheet of water ice which floats upon the surface of a water body.

label: sea ice floe
definition: An ice floe which is formed from frozen sea water, and floats upon the surface of a marine water body.

label: pancake ice
definition: A sea ice floe which has a rounded or circular shape and raised rims.

label: nilas
definition: A sea ice floe which is thin, elastic, continuous, and of a transparent gray color, which results from the freezing of new ice.

label: young ice
definition: A sea ice floe which is inflexible and thicker than nilas.

label: first year ice
definition: Sea ice which has formed over a single freezing season.

label: second year ice
definition: Sea ice which is thicker than first year ice, and has survived a seasonal melting process.

label: multiyear ice
definition: Sea ice which is thicker than second year ice, and has survived more than two seasonal melting process.

label: shuga
definition: New ice, which is spongy, lumpy and opaque, and forms from water which freezes in an agitated water body.

label: slush ice
definition: A slurry of frazil, snow, and liquid water.

label: methane-laden permafrost
definition: Permafrost which contains pockets of trapped methane gas.

label: slab snow
definition: Snow which is cohesive, hard and overlies weaker snow.

label: anthropogenic litter
definition: An anthropogenic environmental material consisting of any object no longer wanted and discarded outside of approved trash receptacles.

label: lake water
definition: Water which is part of a lake.

label: soil organic matter
definition: Organic material in soil, which consists of plant and animal residues at various stages of decomposition, cells and tissues of soil organisms, and substances synthesized by soil organisms.

label: particulate organic matter
definition: Particulate matter which is composed primarily of organic material.

label: particulate organic carbon
definition: Particulate organic matter which is composed primarily of carbon.

label: particulate organic nitrogen
definition: Particulate organic matter which is composed primarily of nitrogen.

label: marine mucilage
definition: A gelatinous material primarily composed of exopolymeric compounds with colloidal properties, formed through the aggregation of marine snow particles, often found in large sheets,  flocs, and clouds.

label: biochar
definition: charcoal that is used as a soil amendment.

label: lignite
definition: A soft, brown, combustible, sedimentary rock formed from naturally compressed peat.

label: bitumous coal
definition: a relatively soft coal containing a tarlike substance called bitumen or asphalt. It is of higher quality than lignite coal but of poorer quality than anthracite. It is an organic sedimentary rock formed by diagenetic and sub metamorphic compression of peat bog material.

label: anthracite
definition: A hard, compact variety of coal that has a submetallic luster. It has the highest carbon content, the fewest impurities, and the highest energy density of all types of coal and is the highest ranking of coal.

label: coke
definition: Coal heated in the absence of air.
